sentences: Kofi Burbridge (September 22, 1961 – February 15, 2019) was an American keyboardist and flautist of the blues and blues rock group Tedeschi Trucks Band.
section: N/A

sentences: Burbridge was born to William and Carol Burbridge in the Bronx, New York, United States, although the family moved to Washington, D.C. two years later.
section: N/A

sentences: Burbridge was a classically-trained multi-instrumentalist who provided keyboards, organ, flute, and backing vocals for various bands throughout his career.
section: N/A

sentences: He was previously part of the Grammy Award-winning Derek Trucks Band.
section: N/A

sentences: He was also the brother of bass player Oteil Burbridge, who is known for his work in the Allman Brothers Band, Aquarium Rescue Unit, Dead & Company, and the Tedeschi Trucks Band.
section: N/A

sentences: Oteil Burbridge cites his brother as his biggest influence and mentioned Kofi was found to have perfect pitch around the age of seven.
section: N/A
== Musical career ==
== Musical career ==

sentences: Burbridge joined his first band in the Atlanta region called Knee-Deep, and the lineup included his brother Oteil and Jeff Sipe on drums.
section: == Musical career ==

sentences: The band broke up after less than a year but introduced him to other notable musicians in the area like Bruce Hampton.
section: == Musical career ==

sentences: He eventually joined the Aquarium Rescue Unit shortly after Col Bruce Hampton left, which reunited him with Oteil Burbridge and Jeff Sipe.
section: == Musical career ==
== Musical career == | === The Derek Trucks Band ===
== Musical career == | === The Derek Trucks Band ===
== Musical career == | === The Derek Trucks Band ===

sentences: Burbridge joined the Derek Trucks Band in 1999.
section: == Musical career == | === The Derek Trucks Band ===

sentences: Both Trucks and Burbridge's brother Oteil were members of the Allman Brothers Band and Kofi occasionally guested with that band.
section: == Musical career == | === The Derek Trucks Band ===

sentences: In 2010, Derek Trucks announced a hiatus for his solo band and formed a new group with his wife, Susan Tedeschi, called the Tedeschi Trucks Band and both Burbridge brothers became members.
section: == Musical career == | === The Derek Trucks Band ===
== Musical career == | === The Tedeschi Trucks Band ===
== Musical career == | === The Tedeschi Trucks Band ===
== Musical career == | === The Tedeschi Trucks Band ===

sentences: In 2010, Kofi joined his brother Oteil Burbridge in the new group, Tedeschi Trucks Band, which merged some former members of The Derek Trucks Band and Susan Tedeschi's former backing band.
section: == Musical career == | === The Tedeschi Trucks Band ===

sentences: The band performed at Eric Clapton's Crossroads Guitar Festival 2010 and appears on the DVD release with two of their songs, "Midnight in Harlem" and "Comin' Home".
section: == Musical career == | === The Tedeschi Trucks Band ===

sentences: The Tedeschi Trucks Band released their debut album, Revelator in 2011, which won the Grammy Award for Best Blues Album at the 54th Grammy Awards.
section: == Musical career == | === The Tedeschi Trucks Band ===

sentences: In 2012, the band released their second album, Everybody's Talkin', a double live album compiled from their 2011 world tour.
section: == Musical career == | === The Tedeschi Trucks Band ===

sentences: On August 2013 their third album, Made Up Mind, their second studio album, was released.
section: == Musical career == | === The Tedeschi Trucks Band ===
== Death ==
== Death ==

sentences: On June 20, 2017, Kofi Burbridge suffered a heart attack, and had surgery to repair an aortic rupture.
section: == Death ==

sentences: After four months of recovery, Burbridge returned to the band in October 2017, but suffered a health setback that was announced on January 4, 2019, by the band.
section: == Death ==

sentences: Burbridge died at the age of 57 on February 15, 2019, the day that Tedeschi Trucks Band's fourth album, Signs, was released.
section: == Death ==
